s.text: USAT 's "USA Snapshot" provides an interesting window into the minds of the rich, revealing that in a survey, members of the nation's wealthiest households said they'd pay $640,000 to get into heaven, and $487,000 for true love, but only $55,000 to be president.

Meanwhile, the NYT says the Hong Kong developments "could lead to a broad regional economic slowdown that would dampen the sales and earnings not just of local companies, but of major corporations from the United States to Europe that operate there."
Hong Kong would have to draw heavily on its own reserves and on those of China to support the market in the face of selling by currency speculators."
And offers this "clarification": "But analysts say the peg won't be easy to defend, however.
